data.description: These positions can be based in one of our manufacturing locations in either Asheville, NC, Fayetteville, NC, Greenwood, SC, or Portland, OR, and will offer relocation assistance. The Product Engineer (often internally referred to as a Custom Order Engineer or COE) is primarily responsible for providing electrical and mechanical design and documentation support for power distribution or control product lines. This includes, but is not limited to engineering designs, collaborating with application engineers and manufacturing associates, utilization of design automation software, and producing/maintaining manufacturing documentation. The annual salary for this role is $75,000 a year. This position offers a one-time $6,000 signing bonus. Bachelor's degree in electrical or mechanical engineering from an accredited institution with a graduation before August 2026 Minimum overall cumulative GPA of 2.8 Minimum of one internship or co-op experience or an equivalent of 3 months of related experience completed at the time of this application Degree in electrical engineering Minimum overall cumulative GPA of 3.2 or higher Knowledge of power distribution products (LV and MV Switchgear, Panelboards and Switchboards, Motor Control Centers, etc.) Position Criteria: Strong analytical, computer, writing, presentation and customer service skills Ability to communicate technical information to customers and manufacturing Knowledge of the fundamentals of electrical and mechanical engineering earlytalent We aspire to ensure the safety, health and wellbeing of our employees. We do this by helping all our employees maximize their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing, both at work and at home. Consult with plant and field sales engineers in interpreting and defining new equipment applications. Develop a variety of complex drawings and bills-of-material based upon established product designs, which provides sufficient detail to accurately convey the purchaser's equipment application. Coordinate mechanical and electrical interfaces with other products. Advise Drafting/Design, Manufacturing, and Purchasing - when required - in interpreting information for the accurate production of equipment in accordance with the purchaser's requirements. Manage purchaser onsite visits to approve and/or release equipment for shipping. Manage Manufacturing and Engineering Change Notices. Demonstrate advanced computer skills with ability to learn required software (Bid Manager, AutoCAD, Design Automation, MAPICS). Consult with Quality in resolving issues after the equipment is shipped, when required. Conduct special development/application projects of a complex nature. Conduct technical training guidance and seminars, as required. Analyze needs and recommend revisions to Department Policies and Procedures.
